intro: Horkelia congesta var. latiloba, commonly known as the broadleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and meadows. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. This variety is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to other Horkelia species.
